Night Shift stops, the heat was getting to him.

"Woahh, we're definitely i=
n the right direction.  But this heat, I don't got that much immunity towar=
d extreme temperatures."

Rat Trap nodds.

"Neither do I.  But we gotta con=
tinue, Cheetor's gotta be out there somewhere."

Night Shift nodds.

"I'm s=
ure he is.  Hot as it is, we'll find 'em, I promise.  We're not gonna give =
up. I only wish there was a way around the thermal vents of this volcano.."=


Rat Trap sniffs the air.

"P.U!  That's worse than what comes outa  Quick=
stride's aft!"

Night Shift looks up.

"Sulfur.  Ohh yeah that stinks.  C'm=
on, let's go.  Stay close."

They continue their trek toward where the Blac=
k Fortress used to stand.

 Ark only carried so many spare tires for my make'n model. Yeah, the speeds=
ters had plenty of spares but the bigger vehicles, they're hard ta find."

oward the Black Fortresses former location.

l in one piece."

> <NEW>
> 
> The next leg of the journey is unevent=
ful. The path that the duo have
> taken has become huge savannas, with the =
trees becoming fewer and
> fewer as they move across hundreds of open miles=
.
> 
> Dinosaurs are plentiful but generally seen at a distance as well as
=
> the mammals and other strange prehistoric beasts and birds. It would
> se=
em that none of them want to have anything to do with the Autobot
> and the=
 Maximal that trek across their landscape.
> 
> Finally, in the distance Ni=
ghtshift and Rat Trap can make out the dark
> billowing clouds of smoke tha=
t would signify a volcanic eruption. The
> skies are darkening as the duo c=
ontinue, the number of animals and
> other life is becoming less and less, =
as noxious clouds of black vapor
> roll across the land. However despite th=
at both Rat Trap and
> Nightshift's compasses are telling them that they ar=
e still going in
> the direction of where the tower once stood.
> 
> At the=
 moment there is still no signal from Cheetor himself or sign of
> his pres=
ence. But then again he was very much closer when his signal
> was cut off.=
 However as they approach, it is becoming more and more
> dangerous as the =
heat is begining to rise.
